body.name: Ulanzi Extendable Photography Light Stand, Adjustable 6.23ft Aluminum Light Tripod, Reversible Portable Studio Lighting Tripod for Continute Output Lighting, Strobe Light, Webcams, Cameras, Softbox
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 2 hrs 38 mins
features: 【Ultra Sturdy Aluminum Light Stand】This professional photography light stand features full metal build with anodized aluminum alloy, durable and corrosion resistant. With thickened tube diameters in all 3 sections, it has a maximum load capacity of 13.2lb/6kg and can easily support a wide range of photography equipment. Ideal for studio and outdoor photography

【 Steady and Sturdy】The tripod base with spread lever helps further stabilize the stand, especially when splaying out the tripod legs. special snap design to adjust the angle, The light stand can be adjusted to a minimum of 45cm to achieve low-angle shooting.

【Widely Compatible】The top of the stand comes with standard 1/4" screw and can be used for mounting strobe lights, reflectors, ring lights, LED light panels, umbrellas, softboxes, and other photography equipment. Sandbags(not included) can be placed on the tripod base for balance keeping
【Height Adjustable】Simply loosen the securing knobs, and then extend or fold the tubes to adjust stand height with ease, height adjustable from 2.49ft/76cm to 6.32ft/190cm

【Foldable & Portable】The legs can be easily unfolded and securely locked in position with the locking knob. The foldable aluminum stand is lightweight for easy transport. Note: Only light stand is included

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 18 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for small lights
reviews.reviewText: I needed a short light stand for a background light. This stand is good for smaller light weight lights from speed lights to small mono lights. In its lowest position I measure it at 18 inches tall so it goes pretty low to the floor. In its tallest safe position it measures 60 inches, that’s with legs in widest position.It’s always best to use a ballast weight like a small sand bag to prevent tipping over. I would not advise using this with any large or heavy light. It’s made well enough for light duty and the price is fair.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I needed a lightweight tripod to hold a webcam in an on-site event. This little tripod is just remarkable. It is super stable even when extended to it's full height. It folds up quickly and small. All parts work smoothly and appear to be made from quality materials.I compared it to several other similar light stands and there is no comparison in the quality of the materials or portability.Probably the most important feature (since I will be recording sound) is that it is completely silent. No vibration noise even if I shake it hard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars The star attraction of this stand is the small compact size when closed.
reviews.reviewText: It is so small when closed that it is possible to put it inside a backpack. Unfortunately when it comes to this design I wouldn’t put no more than an ad300pro on it. It becomes too unstable. It seems that you can’t have it both ways. You have to sacrifice stability for portability. Otherwise a good purchase. I am still using it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The robustness gives a sense of security that is not compared to others of the same price. Totally recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality made and portable
reviews.reviewText: This Ulazi light stand is well made with good quality aluminum and plastic materials. It folds to less than 17 inches making it portable to bring on locations. Ulanzi is a new company that makes well designed and good quality products. Ulazi products reminds me of the company Smallrig who has been around for years making well designed good quality products. This light stand is basically a tripod. It mimics a tripod's ability to adjust the angle of each of the three legs from almost parallel to the ground to 180° upright towards the mounting spigot making the overall size much more compact for travel. Tripods have done this for years so I am surprised this is only one of the first lightstands to copy this feature. This is a great lightstand for lower required heights. At a little over 6 feet tall it is a little short for portrait use unless you use this for seated portraits and baby portraits. I prefer my lightstands to be at least 8 feet tall for adult portraits. Using my Godox AD200 strobe is the heaviest I would feel comfortable putting on this at full height. At lower light heights I would flatten out each leg and place a sandbag weight on the legs to allow for more stability with much bigger and heavier strobes and softbox. I have also used this lightstand with my gimbal and smartphone conected to record video. My gimbal has person tracking that will track the person vertically and horizontally. In this setup this lightstands works brilliantly. Item reviewed: Ulanzi Extendable Photography Light Stand, Adjustable 6.23ft Aluminum Light Tripod, Reversible Portable Studio Lighting Tripod for Continute Output Lighting, Strobe Light, Webcams, Cameras, Softbox

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Surprisingly Strong, Versatile And Portable!
reviews.reviewText: For half the cost of the Chinese-made Italian standard otherwise known as the Nano - this light stand hoists up higher; holds more weight; folds down shorter; and is arguably more stable! Don't get me wrong - I've got several Nanos and I like them a lot... but this stand has some clear advantages.The first thing I really like is that the legs function like a good tripod. They are independent and lock in three different angles - and each has a telescoping section. As a result you can negotiate uneven terrain like a pro. Since they fold up against the mast - no space is wasted and the the folded length is only ~17 inches!Also since each leg has a telescoping section - the legs can spread very wide offering a big stance and more stability. Need even more stability? If you aren't overloading the stand - hang a weight like a backpack from the hook beneath the mast and let that low center of gravity work in your favor. Excellent when working with light modifiers like umbrellas and softboxes.I also really like the satin black anodized aluminum with matching hardware. It looks great and professional. My only nitpick is I wish the clamping hardware was adjustable so that in the future should they get a little loose I would have a way to tighten them back up.All things considered - I'm pleased with this light stand and plan to order a few more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Light Stand
reviews.reviewText: Ulanzi never disappoints me. This is a great light stand. It is made of aluminum and is light weight yet sturdy. The bars extend easily and tighten nicely. I did not notice any slipping of the bars once extended. The top has a ¼” threaded mount which fits most everything I have. It only extends to about 6 feet which is fine for many situations. It would be nice if it was a little higher, though. When fully collapsed, it is a great size for carrying. The bottom legs also have extensions. All the bars are slightly crimped which in my opinion adds to the sturdiness and ensures the stand will not bend. The hinging mechanisms are sturdy as well. Overall it’s a five star stand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great stands for travel.
reviews.reviewText: I was impressed with these stands. Initially bought two and then ordered two more. They're not super heavy-duty, but perfectly fine for small fixtures. The extending legs make them a lot more steady than other stands of similar size and cost.
